questions.question: What is the primary function of the cambium layer in grafting?
choices: To provide nutrients to the plant
To produce new wood and bark cells
To protect the plant from diseases
To store water for the plant
questions.answer: To produce new wood and bark cells

questions.question: Which type of grafting has the highest success rate?
questions.answer: Intraspecific grafting

questions.question: What is the purpose of the rootstock in grafting?
choices: To provide the root system and foundation
To determine the shape of the leaves
questions.answer: To provide the root system and foundation

questions.question: Which grafting technique is best for thick rootstocks (2-10 cm diameter)?
questions.answer: Cleft graft

questions.question: What is the ideal temperature range for post-grafting care?
Which of the following is NOT a criterion for selecting rootstock?
questions.answer: Fruit quality

questions.question: What is the purpose of grafting tape or rubber bands in post-grafting care?
choices: To provide nutrients to the graft union
To prevent desiccation and pathogen entry
To change the color of the graft
questions.answer: To prevent desiccation and pathogen entry

questions.question: Which grafting technique is best for rootstocks and scions of equal diameter (0.5-2 cm)?
questions.answer: Whip and tongue graft

questions.question: What is the recommended humidity level for post-grafting care?
When is the best time to collect scion wood?
questions.answer: During dormancy

questions.question: What is the primary purpose of the scion in grafting?
choices: To determine the size of the plant
To contribute desired characteristics like fruit quality
questions.answer: To contribute desired characteristics like fruit quality

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a step in graft union formation?
questions.answer: Development of new root hairs

questions.question: What is the purpose of making a tongue cut in the whip and tongue graft?
choices: To increase the surface area for union
To make the graft more flexible
questions.answer: To increase the surface area for union

questions.question: How many buds should typically be present on a scion?
What is the main advantage of the side veneer graft?
choices: It's ideal for rootstocks and scions of equal diameter
It's suitable for rootstocks significantly larger than scions
It's the easiest technique for beginners
questions.answer: It's suitable for rootstocks significantly larger than scions

questions.question: Why is it important to remove rootstock sprouts promptly after grafting?
choices: They may compete with the scion for nutrients
They help balance the plant's growth
questions.answer: They may compete with the scion for nutrients

questions.question: What is the primary reason for providing shade to newly grafted plants?
questions.answer: To reduce transpiration

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a common application of grafting?
choices: Changing the variety of an established tree
Increasing the genetic diversity of a species
questions.answer: Increasing the genetic diversity of a species

questions.question: What is the main purpose of grafting wax?
choices: To provide nutrients to the graft union
To seal the union and protect it from moisture loss
questions.answer: To seal the union and protect it from moisture loss

questions.question: How long does it typically take for a graft union to heal?
questions.answer: Several weeks

questions.question: What is the primary reason for using disease-resistant rootstock?
choices: To protect the entire plant from soil-borne diseases
questions.answer: To protect the entire plant from soil-borne diseases

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a factor affecting graft compatibility?
questions.answer: Leaf shape

questions.question: What is the main advantage of interspecific grafting over intraspecific grafting?
choices: Allows for combining traits from different species
questions.answer: Allows for combining traits from different species

questions.question: Why is it important to use clean, sharp tools when grafting?
choices: To prevent the introduction of pathogens
To improve the aesthetic appearance of the graft
questions.answer: To prevent the introduction of pathogens

questions.question: What is the primary reason for gradually reducing humidity and increasing light exposure after grafting?
questions.answer: To harden off the plant

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a benefit of grafting in fruit tree production?
choices: Combining disease resistance with high-quality fruit
questions.answer: Improving soil quality

questions.question: What is the main purpose of making angled cuts in the whip and tongue graft?
choices: To allow for better water uptake
To increase the surface area for cambium contact
To make the graft more flexible
To reduce the risk of disease
questions.answer: To increase the surface area for cambium contact

questions.question: Why is it important to match the diameter of the rootstock and scion in some grafting techniques?
choices: To ensure proper alignment of cambium layers
To reduce the risk of graft rejection
questions.answer: To ensure proper alignment of cambium layers

questions.question: What is the primary reason for wrapping a graft union?
choices: To hold components together and prevent drying
questions.answer: To hold components together and prevent drying

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a common reason for grafting?
choices: To propagate plants that are difficult to root from cuttings
To increase genetic diversity in a population
questions.answer: To increase genetic diversity in a population
